review: Inferior to everything else I've tried.  The streaming speed is sub-par for both local media server (Plex) and internet streaming content (Netflix, ESPN).  Both buffered several times in the first minute from the same location I stream football (Sunday Ticket) and Netflix through my PS4 (also wireless connected).  The Roku in the other room never has issues with streaming content either.I had high hopes for this, but it seems like it's a wasted purchase (plus the $5 Plex app that I used once for 5 minutes).  Spend the money on a Roku.

review: I can't even get started.  I wonder if I have a finicky remote control. I found this quote from a review: "The remote control is finicky. Sometimes it fails to register button presses; other times, a single button press repeats many times in a row."  Which doesn't sound so bad, unless you can't join the wifi network.Here's my experience:I opened the box, plugged it in as directed (had to use the HDMI extender), and saw the splash screen on the TV.So far so good.Clicked PLAY to startClicked SELECT to pick my WifI networkThe remote works!Then the on-screen keyboard showed up so I could type my WiFi password.The wheel-nav on the remote seems broken. Even the lightest press seems to send a continuous stream of "move move move" commands and the cursor slams up against the right side of the virtual keyboard. The nav wheel seems to  also be scrambled, I can't seem to get a consistent behavior (sometimes the picker scrolls the direction i click, sometimes down, etc).  I took a video too..Needless to say I can't evaluate the product w/o being able to attach the network.The other setup option "use the virtual keyboard in the app" isn't viable until the FireStick can join the network, so im stuck.I'll contact Amazon support and see if they've had problems with the remote and if I can get a new one.still Hopeful...
author: mtakacs

review: It works well, to my expectation. Wish there are more TV channels but i suppose as long as you have either netflix/hulu/hbo this is enough for a "non" smart TV. I like the control, feels very smooth to touch and operate. There are some lag between pressing the bottom and navigating through the menus. Not enough to cause a huge issue and i'm not sure if that's due to the fire stick itself or my internet connection. However, I have realize that after prolong usage, sometimes the loading screen can get stuck and the stick need to be cool off or restarted (lol...a fire stick that needs to be cooled off). Only happened few times. I also wish there's an actual off button or selection in the menu so I don't have to navigate through 5 different places just to put the stick to sleep. Because technically, even after you turned off the tv, the stick is still "functioning" and i suppose this could sap away bandwidth? Just my two cents on a new product that still have potential to grow :)
